roleset.name: notice an odor, act of smelling
roleset.note: SMELL-V NOTES: Member of VNcls see-30.1, stalk-35.3. Updated by Julia, 11/2010. (from smell.01-v)
SMELL-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on smell-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls see-30.1, stalk-35.3. (from smell.01-n)

roles.note: Watch out for light verbs! (from smell.01-n)

example.name: simple transitive
example.text: We see, smell and hear slums filled with ``the echoes of hawkers advertising their wares interspersed with abusive language, rattling coughs and the sound of people gathering spittle in their throats and spewing into the street.''
example.arg: slums filled with ``the echoes of hawkers advertising their wares interspersed with abusive language, rattling coughs and the sound of people gathering spittle in their throats and spewing into the street

example.name: Light verb!
example.text: *pro*-1 Try [*pro*-1]-2 to take a smell of the cigar and if it does not have that aroma, drop it off.

roleset.name: emit an odor
roleset.note: SMELL-V NOTES: Member of VNcls smell_emission-43.3, stimulus_subject-30.4. Updated by Julia, 11/2010. (from smell.02-v)

example.name: smells like Teen Spirit
example.text: Embedded in the ``budget'' being concocted by the House-Senate conference committee is something that-1 *trace*-1 looks, smells and waddles like a duck.

example.name: predicative smell
example.text: ``It's a Swiss-cheese factory and the cheese smells pretty good,'' commented one veteran lobbyist who was watching the proceedings.
